alert.note: Alert for Hill (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 24 at 5:49AM CST until December 25 at 3:20PM CST by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions Hill, Johnson, and Tarrant counties in North Texas. * WHEN...Until 730 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water on roadways is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Worth, Arlington, Irving, Grand Prairie, Mansfield, Euless, Grapevine, Coppell, Hillsboro, Kennedale, Keene, Alvarado, Rendon, Venus, Pantego, Whitney, Itasca, Grandview, Blum and Covington.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
